title: 1961 Chevrolet Corvette

description: For sale in our Chicago showroom is a shimmering 1960 Chevrolet Corvette.  The C-1 Corvettes have always been popular and were completely redesigned in 1958 with quad headlights and were very attractive cars for the period and remain an icon today. One of the very popular designs of the time was the exhaust coming through the rear bumper removing the ugly exhaust tips dangling from the underside of the trunk pan.  This beauty is finished in Sierra Gold Metallic which was a popular color on the 1957 Chevrolet, another American icon.  The interior has been beautifully restored and finished in pearl white which is a lovely contrast to that glittering gold metallic pain.  Under the hood you will be pleased to see the original, numbers matching 283 Cubic Inch V8 that was rated at 230 Horsepower which is not too shabby for a fiberglass bodied car.  Mated to that small block Chevy V8 is the automatic Powerglide transmission which was known for smooth shifting and superior durability.  Of the 10,261 units produced in 1960 only 1,563 were produced with the Powerglide transmission.  Additional options on this vehicle include the popular Wonderbar Radio, sun shades and a cozy heater for those chilly days.  This car has had years of loving care and recent work including brakes and wheel cylinders, new convertible top, new interior, new exhaust and tune-up.  If you have been waiting for that eye-catching first generation Corvette to come around that has a touch of unique flair this may be the one for you.  Located in our Chicago showroom, this restored 1960 Chevrolet Corvette can be seen including an HD video and pictures at www.gatewayclassiccars.com.  For additional information please call (708) 444-4488 or email chicago@gatewayclassiccars.com

Optioned with T-10 transmission, AM/FM radio, dual fours, aluminized off road exhaust, sunvisors, courtesy light, heater, seat belts, hubcaps, and wide white tires. Documented with the restoration receipts and has a slew of shop and Corvette related manuals. Looks, runs, and drives very nice.

title: 1961 Chevrolet Corvette

description: 1960 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray now on consignment with Gulf Coast Exotic Auto.
Engine is a V8 with a 4 speed manual transmission. Numbers Matching Car!
Corvette Restorations rebuilt this car in October of 2005. It was a complete frame off restoration.

The body of the Vette was completely removed from the frame, Stripped all interior and exterior and replaced with new. The convertible top frame and the chassis frame were both sand blasted and detailed in GM restoration black, Rebuilt Transmission, Installed all new brakes and lines, Installed all new wiring harness (front to rear), All bumpers were chromed and any other parts that needed re-chromed, All glass and gaskets removed and replaced, All dash gages were completely rebuilt. The body of the Corvette is painted with PPG Products, K-36 Primmer. The car is base coat and clear coat DBU base and 2002 Clear, it is also sanded and buffed 3 times to be better than showroom finish. We have all paperwork of the work completed along with pictures of the whole process.
Runs and drives like new. Beautiful color combination.
For more information please call Brandon 228-697-3301 or Chris 228-547-3600.
We Offer Finance Options, Trade-Ins, Extended Warranties, and World Wide Shipping.
title: 1960 Chevrolet Corvette

description: 1960 Corvette Conv. Rare Honduras Maroon exterior with black interior and a white softie/cove. Mostly original paint with what we feel is a pretty much unhit body! We got this car from an older lady who inherited this car from her father when he passed away. Her father was a Brigadier General in the United States Air Force, and also a bomber/fighter pilot in WW2 and the Korean War was the 2nd owner of this corvette! His daughter spent a lot of money making this a great reliable car but didn't want it repainted as she wanted to retain as much of the originality as she could while also making it reliable enough to drive everyday. The entire driveline and all suspension/bushings/tie rods/etc... were all redone around 2008 and I have all the receipts to go with the car! Under the hood you will find the Correct Original Numbers Matching 283ci/230hp engine with all correct components such as generator, radiator, valve covers, intake, carb, etc and the correct 4-speed manual transmission. Great running and driving corvette you can get in and go ANYWHERE! The Black interior has all the correct gauges, door panels, carpet, and wonderbar radio. The entire heater ventilation system has been restored and works as it should as do all the gauges, headlights, turn signals, interior lights, and horn. You will look long and hard to find a 1960 corvette as well taken care of and as sorted out as this one! You can jump in this car and use it the way it is with no problems or you can have it repainted and go win shows! If you have any more questions or want more pictures/info you can call/text me anytime @: 814-285-1779. You can see all my inventory @: www.allcorvettes.net Don’t let this one slip away, always remember The Corvette You Are Looking at Today & Thinking About Buying Tomorrow is, The Same Corvette That Someone Else Looked at Yesterday and is Buying Today…

title: 1960 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Beautiful C1 Corvette with Rochester fuel injected 283/290hp engine and four speed manual transmission. Paint color is Inca silver with black coves, black interior, new soft top and hard top. Meticulously maintained since a professional restoration in 2004, this is a show quality, correct configuration car. Scored 93.6 by National Corvette Restorers Society. Always a Southern California car, three owners since new, and only one owner over the past 30 years. Includes significant documentation and receipts for the 30-year period.
Chevrolet built a total of 9,670 Corvettes in 1959, 745 of which were equipped with the Rochester Ram-Jet fuel injection option and only 957 produced in the Inca Silver color.
·      Inca Silver with black coves and black interior, new black soft top.
·      Four speed Borg-Warner T-10 manual transmission.
·      Chrome condition and the interior condition is excellent.
·      Repainted 20 years ago, the finish is excellent overall with a few minor blemishes.
·      Includes removable hard top.
·      Heater delete, sun visor delete.
·      Refurbished Wonder Bar radio.
·      Odometer shows 39,610 miles.
·      Engine ID Number: F404CS.
·      Engine casting number: 3756519.
·      Fuel Injection: 7017300, serial: 1313.

Financing available. Vehicle shown by appointment only. Price does not include license, title and administrative fees. California residents also pay sales tax. Visit www.johnston-motorsports.com for more information.
